1.text: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.

2.text: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.

3.text: And dost thou open thy eyes upon such one, and bring me into judgment with thee?

4.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.

5.text: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months is with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

6.text: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as a hireling, his day.

7.text: For there is hope of a tree, if it is cut down, that it will sprout again, and that its tender branch will not cease.

8.text: Though its root shall become old in the earth, and its stock die in the ground;

9.text: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

10.text: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yes, man yieldeth his breath, and where is he?

11.text: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:

12.text: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens shall be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

13.text: O that thou wouldst hide me in the grave, that thou wouldst keep me secret, until thy wrath is past, that thou wouldst appoint me a set time, and remember me!

14.text: If a man dieth, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change shall come.

15.text: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thy hands.

16.text: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

17.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up my iniquity.

18.text: And surely the mountain falling cometh to naught, and the rock is removed out of its place.

19.text: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

20.text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

21.text: His sons come to honor, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.

22.text: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
